business.headline: Cryptocurrency a bigger challenge to dollar than BRICS currency, says WEF PresidentSpeaking in an exclusive conversation with India Today TV, Brende said de-dollarisation is unlikely in the near term. He added that cryptocurrency is a bigger challenge to the dollar than a potential BRICS currency.

India powers 18% of global growth, WEF chief sees tariff row with US easing soonIn an exclusive interaction with India Today TV, WEF President Borge Brende described India's rapid expansion as a source of "exported prosperity" to the world. "Just imagine what it means for global prosperity. So, you are exporting prosperity by growing so fast," he said.

A widow's wait, a worker's fight: The human struggle behind PF claimsIn Part 2 of our series on the PF claim crisis, we look at why, for so many Indians, withdrawing their own savings has turned into a struggle, forcing them to fight for money that is rightfully theirs.

Will October bring a market breakout? Earnings, GST price cuts fuel hopeAdani stocks led the rally on Thursday following Sebi's dismissal of Hindenburg Research allegations. Experts say this could mark the start of renewed market optimism.
Sensex, Nifty end lower amid profit booking; Adani Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 387.73 points to close at 82,626.23, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.55 points to settle at 25,327.05.

Explained: Why Intel shares jumped 22% after Nvidia's $5 billion investmentThe Nvidia-Intel deal not only fuels Intel's stock surge but strengthens its next-gen manufacturing and product integration, creating potential market shifts that could challenge competitors like AMD over the coming years.

Waiting for your ITR refund? Here is how to track itAfter filing your ITR, the next big question is, when will the refund come? Instead of guessing, you can quickly check the progress on the official portal.
Sensex tumbles 500 points: Is the stock market rally over?Around midday, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 471.67 points, settling at 82,542.29, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 130.20 points to 25,293.40.

Does the Income Tax Department delay refunds above Rs 50,000?With the ITR deadline now behind us, many taxpayers are anxiously waiting for their refunds. A common doubt is whether larger refunds, such as those above Rs 50,000, take longer to arrive.

New GST rates from September 22: Why you should double-check product MRPsConsumers must remain alert as new GST rates take effect September 22; checking MRPs carefully ensures savings are realised, avoiding overpayment due to old pricing or retailer confusion.

Adani Power in focus as Sebi clean chit sparks fresh rally in Adani Group stocksAdani Power's move stood out, as analysts see strong momentum beyond the short-term sentiment boost. Global brokerage Morgan Stanley has initiated coverage with an 'Overweight' rating and a target price of Rs 818 per share.

Adani stocks jump up to 10 % after Sebi clean chit in Hindenburg caseThe gains were broad-based across the group's listed entities. Adani Total Gas led the rally, soaring 10% on the BSE. Adani Power climbed 7%, while flagship Adani Enterprises advanced nearly 5%.

entertainment.headline: Kiss review: A cheesy romantic fantasy starring Kavin that tugs at your emotionsRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025Kiss movie review: The Tamil film, written and directed by National award-winning choreographer Sathish Krishnan, stars Kavin and Preeti Israni in the lead. 'Kiss' is a breezy romantic film that is worth watching.

BIFF 2025 Day 3: Kim Da-mi, Dear X screening, and Lee Byung-hun headline BusanThe 30th Busan International Film Festival continued its vibrant run on day 3 with major premieres and star appearances. The event highlighted Netflix hits and exclusive reveals, promising an exciting festival ahead.

Homebound selection for Oscars 2026 a unanimous decision: Film Federation of IndiaThe Film Federation of India president, Firdausul Hasan reflected on 'Homebound' being selected as India's official entry for the 98th Academy Awards. In an exclusive interview with India Today, he stated that the film was unanimously selected by a 14-member jury.

Anurag Kashyap calls out Bollywood's toxicity, criticises AI in cinemaAnurag Kashyap criticised the "toxicity" in Bollywood and said the industry can never be united. He also slammed AI-generated cinema, calling it unethical and warning that actors will only unite when technology begins replacing them.

Homebound co-writer Sumit Roy expresses pride as film gets picked for Oscars 2026Director Neeraj Ghaywan's film 'Homebound' has been selected for the Oscars race. The film's co-writer Sumit Roy reacted to the news expressing pride on representing India globally.

Zubeen Garg, Assam's OG pop balladeer, and the question Gaane ki AaneZubeen Garg wasn't just a singer. He was the voice of Assam, weaving raw emotion into every note that defined generations. From the superhit Maya to intimate folk melodies, Zubeen left an indelible mark. He proved that true music transcends time and controversy.

Karan Johar calls Homebound a labour of love as film heads to Oscars 2026Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound', produced by Karan Johar, has been selected as India's official entry for Oscars 2026 in the Best International Feature category. Calling it a "labour of love," Johar expressed pride, while Ghaywan said representing India on a global stage was both "humbling and a matter of pride."

Rohit Saraf flaunts his abs in Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari song BTS picsRohit Saraf shared behind-the-scenes pictures from the new Holi song 'Panwadi' in his upcoming film 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari'.

Zubeen Garg's sister Jonkey Borthakur died in accident; tragedy shaped musicLife's cruel symmetry has played out for the Borthakur family, after Assam's pop star Zubeen Garg lost his life during a sea outing in Singapore. Twenty-three years ago, Zubeen's sister, Jonkey, met with a road accident that resulted in the death of the 20-year-old singer and actor. Her death in 2002 left young Zubeen devastated and shaped his music, spirit, and musical journey.

Neeraj Ghaywan's Homebound picked as India's official entry to OscarsDirector Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' has been selected as India's official entry for Oscars 2026. The film features Ishaan Khatter, Janhvi Kapoor and Vishal Jethwa in key roles.

Jr NTR injured during ad shoot, advised rest for few weeks: Official statementTelugu superstar Jr NTR suffered a minor injury while shooting an ad. His team confirmed he is stable, recovering well, and advised rest for a few weeks. Fans are urged not to speculate.

Zubeen Garg dies at 52: Fans pay tribute to Assamese icon's musical legacySinger Zubeen Garg died at 52 after a scuba diving accident in Singapore. Fans mourned his death while cherishing his music and contribution towards Assamese culture.

Apateu, Apateu! How a Korean drinking game became world's newest pop obsessionIn this week's K-fix, we discuss how Rose and Bruno Mars' 'APT.' turns a Korean drinking game into a viral anthem, uniting fans worldwide with its addictive chant and playful lyrics.

Lord Curzon Ki Haveli: Anshuman Jha's directorial debut hits theatres this OctoberThe much-awaited black comedy thriller 'Lord Curzon Ki Haveli', marking Anshuman Jha's directorial debut, is set to release in Indian theatres on October 10 after a successful international festival run.

Zubeen Garg dies at 52: Vishal Dadlani, Armaan Malik lead social media tributesThe sudden death of Zubeen Garg, the iconic Assamese singer and composer, has deeply saddened the music and film fraternity across India. Revered as the voice of Assam, his death was mourned by Vishal Dadlani, Pritam, Armaan Malik, among others.

Jolly LLB 3 X reviews: Akshay Kumar called content king by fansAkshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi-starrer 'Jolly LLB 3' was released in theatres today. The fans have been sharing their reviews on social media, calling Akshay the content king.

Mirage review: Underwhelming Jeethu Joseph crime thriller that barely takes offRelease Date:Fri Sep 19, 2025'Mirage' movie review: Mirage is a Malayalam crime thriller co-written and directed by Jeethu Joseph of 'Drishyam' fame. The film is set around a financial scam and an accidental death that leads to deeper, darker revelations.

Harshdeep Kaur's soulful Ik Onkar resonates at Sikh Sangat led by PM Modi. WatchSinger Harshdeep Kaur met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the eve of his 75th birthday and called the moment an honour. At Modi's request, she sang a soulful rendition of 'Ik Onkar' from Gurbani.

Remembering Zubeen Garg, the Ya Ali singer and Assam's cultural icon who lives onZubeen Garg, a celebrated singer and musician from Assam, died at the age of 52 in Singapore. He was scheduled to perform at the ongoing Northeast Festival and died after a scuba diving accident. Garg was a multi-talented artiste known for his work in several Indian languages, and his loss has left a significant void in the music industry.

general news.headline: Saudi-Pak defence pact will change life for India: Ian BremmerGeopolitical expert Ian Bremmer said Saudi Arabia's decision to sign a mutual defence pact with Pakistan will have far-reaching consequences for South Asia, particularly India.

Trump signs order imposing $100,000 annual fee for H-1B visa applicationsUS President Donald Trump signed a proclamation imposing a $100,000 annual fee on H-1B visas, a sweeping overhaul expected to hit Indian workers hardest as they dominate approvals.

2 jawans killed, 5 injured in firing on Assam Rifles convoy in ManipurUnknown gunmen ambushed an Assam Rifles convoy near Nambol Sabal Leikai in Manipur's Bishnupur district on Friday evening, killing two jawans and leaving five wounded.

Is US pushing India towards China with tariffs? What WEF chief Borge Brende saidWorld Economic Forum (WEF) President and CEO Borge Brende used the metaphor of panda and an elephant sharing a space to describe the India-China relationship.

BJP gets Gen Z bragging rightsEven as Congress leader Rahul Gandhi sought to woo Gen Z amid his "vote chori" pitch, the Delhi University Students Union (DUSU) election results will hand the BJP the bragging rights of support from that segment of the population. The ABVP, the student wing of the RSS, won three of the four key posts in the DUSU election, while Congress' NSUI won just one. Earlier this year, the ABVP gained ground at JNU, considered to be a left bastion.

Experimental India survive Oman scare ahead of rematch vs PakistanAsia Cup 2025: India were fully focused on giving their untested batters and bowlers game time in their dead-rubber against Oman. Ahead of the Super 4s, India found answers in Abu Dhabi. Oman, meanwhile, walked away with the belief that they could trouble bigger teams.

TikTok deal approved, will visit China next year: Trump after call with XiUS President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping spoke for the first time since June, moving closer to a deal that would allow TikTok to continue operating in the US. The two leaders also discussed trade, fentanyl, and agreed to meet at the APEC Summit in South Korea next month, with reciprocal visits planned in 2026.

India better positioned than EU in current geopolitics, Ian Bremmer explains howUS political scientist Ian Bremmer said that India is better positioned than many countries, because it is not only a leader of the Global South, but also an effective bridge with the West.

Didn't mean to...: Sam Pitroda defends 'feel at home in Pak' remark after backlashSam Pitroda had triggered controversy after he said he "felt at home" during his visits to Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Nepal. He has now issued a statement clarifying his earlier remarks.
The 80% gap: Why most Indians are underinsured and why it's time to actThe solution lies in choosing a comprehensive life cover that reflects modern realities.

University of Bath School of Management: Where Careers Begin With ConfidenceWith students from over 160 countries and a strong alumni network spanning 130 nations, the School creates a community that feels global in reach yet personal in experience.

When India gave China a bloody nose in forgotten battles of 1967After its humiliating defeat to China in the 1962 war, India turned the tables just a few years later. In two little-known battles in 1967 at Nathu La and Cho La, fought weeks apart, Indian forces pushed back the Chinese and restored a measure of pride. Eighty-eight Indian bravehearts laid down their lives, but the toll on the Chinese side was over 300. This victory cemented India's hold over Sikkim, and shattered China's aura of invincibility.
JCB stirring dal in viral video leaves internet worried about food hygieneA video showing a JCB machine being used to stir dal has gone viral on social media.

Zubeen Garg's sister Jonkey Borthakur died in accident; tragedy shaped musicLife's cruel symmetry has played out for the Borthakur family, after Assam's pop star Zubeen Garg lost his life during a sea outing in Singapore. Twenty-three years ago, Zubeen's sister, Jonkey, met with a road accident that resulted in the death of the 20-year-old singer and actor. Her death in 2002 left young Zubeen devastated and shaped his music, spirit, and musical journey.

India-US tariff row just a hiccup, relations to rebound: World Economic Forum CEOWorld Economic Forum President Borge Brende remarked that the recent tariff-driven turbulence in India-US relations is only a temporary setback, as decades of shared interests and cooperation will ensure ties are quickly restored and strengthened.

Noah Lyles emulates Usain Bolt with 4th 200m gold, historic double for MelissaWorld Athletics Championships: Noah Lyles matched Usain Bolt's record of four straight world 200m titles with a dramatic win on Friday. Melissa Jefferson-Wooden completed the sprint double in Tokyo, becoming the first American woman to do so at the world meet.

Terror has a new address in Pakistan after Operation SindoorTerror groups like Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) and Hizbul Mujahideen are deliberately moving their infrastructure deeper into Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, calculating that KPK offers greater protection from future strikes by India.

Thaw between India and China in world's interest, says Ian BremmerPolitical scientist Ian Bremmer said a thaw between India and China would serve global interests by reducing tensions and enabling greater trade and diplomacy. He described the current international order as a "G-zero world" with no clear global leader and argued that India was better positioned than most countries.
ULIPs & Mutual Funds: Why you need both for a balanced portfolioULIPs give you protection and discipline for the long haul, while mutual funds give you liquidity and flexibility for the near term.
3 Russian aircraft violate Estonia's airspace, Nato scrambles jetsThe violation of Estonia's airspace comes just over a week after Nato planes downed Russian drones over Poland.

Mumbai to get India's largest cruise terminal today, here's how it looksPM Modi will inaugurate Mumbai's International Cruise Terminal at Ballard Pier today, marking a major boost for India's maritime infrastructure, set to handle one million passengers annually and elevate the city as a premier global cruise tourism hub.

Donald Trump's $15 billion lawsuit against NYT over Epstein reports dismissedTrump sued The New York Times over its reporting on him over the decades, including his links to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

Ex-US NSA Susan Rice says Trump policies risk a huge loss if India shifts away from USFormer US NSA Susan Rice has called India a "proud and strong" nation that may go in a different direction, and criticised the Trump administration's India strategy.

Trump says US military strike kills 3 on drug-smuggling vessel, third this monthUS President Donald Trump said the US military carried out its third fatal strike this month on a suspected drug-smuggling vessel, killing three alleged narcotraffickers in international waters.

sports.headline: Suryakumar Yadav snubs Pakistan again in post-match chat after beating OmanIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav once again snubbed Pakistan after their Asia Cup victory over Oman. Suryakumar refrained from taking Pakistan's name as hugged the opposing team's players after the match.

After snubbing Pakistan, India share warm hugs with Oman in Asia CupThe Indian cricket team shared warm hugs with Oman players after the conclusion of their final group-stage match of the Asia Cup. India captain Suryakumar Yadav spent some time with the Oman cricket team as well, sharing insights.

Arshdeep fastest pacer to 100 T20I wickets, overtakes Pakistan's Haris RaufIndia fast bowler Arshdeep Singh became the first India players to pick up 100 T20I wickets. Arshdeep made his T20I debut in 2022.

Don't consider Irfan Pathan a man: Shahid Afridi reignites dog meat controversyFormer Pakistan Shahid Afridi has reignited his animosity with Irfan Pathan. Afridi has responded to Irfan Pathan's dog meat story and has publicly dismissed the former India player's claims. Afridi further added that he does not consider Irfan a real man.

Gautam Gambhir ensured nothing went wrong in Delhi's domestic team: Unmukt ChandUnmukt Chand praised Gautam Gambhir's leadership during his Delhi cricket tenure. He revealed internal politics led to his removal and expressed disappointment over team issues after Gambhir's retirement.

Forgetful like Rohit, selfless like Rohit: Suryakumar demotes himself to No. 11Asia Cup 2025: India captain Suryakumar Yadav skipped batting against Oman, giving the untested middle order valuable time in the middle. India posted 188 for 8 in Abu Dhabi, with Sanju Samson scoring a fifty.

Dunith Wellalage to rejoin Sri Lanka team after attending father's funeralSri Lanka spinner Dunith Wellalage will rejoin the national team after attending his late father's funeral. His father died during their fixture Asia Cup fixture against Afghanistan.

Melissa Jefferson-Wooden completed the sprint double in Tokyo, becoming the first American woman to do so at the world meet.

Melissa Jefferson-Wooden completed the sprint double in Tokyo, becoming the first American woman to do so at the world meet.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
